fdd:FDD.titleName: PDF/R-1, (Raster image transport and storage). Encrypted, based on PDF 2.0 (ISO 32000-2)

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: PDF/R-1, encrypted. Based on PDF 2.0 as defined in ISO 32000-2. ISO 23504-1: Document management applications -- Raster image transport and storage -- Part 1: Use of ISO 32000.

fdd:description.p: A variant of PDF/R-1 designed for storing and transmitting scanned page image data that must be encrypted. It is based on ISO 32000-2 (PDF 2.0) in order to take advantage of more secure encryption than supported in ISO 32000-1. All restrictions on unencrypted PDF/R-1 files apply except that the Header must be %PDF-2.0 and the Crypt filter is allowed.

The encryption employed must use the "Standard security handler" as described in subclause 7.6.4 of ISO 32000-2:2020. The only encryption algorithm supported is the AES algorithm with a key length of 256.

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: A limited subset of PDF/R-1, based on ISO 32000-2 (PDF 2.0), designed for storing and transmitting scanned page image data that must be encrypted. PDF/R-1 is intended to allow applications to communicate with scanners without the need for proprietary scanner drivers. Sometimes referred to as PDF/raster.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: PDF/R (Raster image transport and storage) based on PDF 1.4-1.7.

fdd:documentation.p: The specification for encrypted PDF/R-1 documents is in the same document as the specification for unencrypted PDF/R-1 documents. The format for the encrypted variant is based on ISO 32000-2 (aka PDF 2.0), whereas the unencrypted variant is based on ISO 32000-1. See specification of PDF/R-1 as submitted for international standardization to the ISO/TC 171/SC 2. The ISO catalog record for PDF/R is https://www.iso.org/standard/75804.html. See also PDF/R-1.

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:techProtection: The PDF/R-1 specification indicates that the variant based on ISO 32000-2 (PDF 2.0) should only be used for encrypted documents.

fdd:stillImageQF.fdd:normalImage: For all quality and functionality factors, see PDF/R-1

fdd:filenameExtension.fdd:note: Used for all PDF documents. See PDF_family.

fdd:internetMediaType.fdd:note: Used for all PDF documents. See PDF_family.

fdd:values.fdd:note: The version of the PDF/R specification is identified in a comment line in the PDF trailer, located immediately before the line containing startxref. The form of the comment is %PDF-raster-x.y, where x is the major version number and y is minor version number. For the initial specification, the version is 1.0
PRONOM has no entry for any variant of PDF/R as of June 2020.
There is no Wikidata Title ID for any variant of PDF/R as of June 2020.

fdd:urlReference.comment: Links to the specification submitted to ISO. As a result of the ISO standardization process, the name PDF/R is now used instead of PDF/raster.
